text: Dvin massacre was a special operation carried out by the Georgian troops aimed at cleansing the city of Dvin from the local Muslim population. == Details == On 16 July 1162, Georgian troops gathered in massive numbers and invaded the city of Dvin, Azerbaijan. Once the Georgians captured the city, they started killing the male population of the city and surrounding areas. They raped women along with burning the local mosques. The enslaved women ended up naked and were lead to the mainland Georgia ==References== Category:Massacres Category:1162 Category:History of Azerbaijan Category:History of Georgia (country)
title: Dvin massacre
